title: Double Chocolate Cupcakes
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a high speed blender (I used my Vitamix), combine non-dairy milk, applesauce, dates, coffee grinds and vanilla and blend until very smooth.
In a bowl, mix together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Melt the unsweetened baking chocolate in a double broiler or in the microwave.
Pour the date mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Stir in melted chocolate, being careful not to over mix.
Pour mixture evenly into cupcake pan (I made 10 instead of 12).
Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20-30 minutes.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until smooth.
ingredients: 1¼ cup non-dairy milk (I used easy semi-homemade coconut milk)
⅔ cup pitted dates (soaked at least 4 hours)
1½ cup gluten-free flour (I used oat flour, which I made my grinding oats in my Vitamix)
3 tablespoons liquid sweetener (I used maple syrup)
2 tablespoons non-dairy milk (I used easy semi-homemade coconut milk)
